common.invalidConfigurationClientOrWindowNotLoa: Invalid configuration: client or window was not loaded
common.confirmQuitMessage: Are you sure you want to quit {{appName}}?

favorites.title: Favorites
favorites.hint: Right-click a folder and choose "Add to Favorites"

confirmOverwrite.title: Confirm Overwrite File(s)
confirmOverwrite.copyText: This copy operation will overwrite an existing file. Would you like to continue?
confirmOverwrite.moveText: This move operation will overwrite an existing file. Would you like to continue?

invalidTarget.title: Invalid Drop Target
invalidTarget.text: Can't copy or move a folder into itself.

onboarding.openSourceDesc: We're open source and committed to providing a free terminal for individual users. Please show your support by giving us a star on <1>Github (wavetermdev/waveterm)
onboarding.communityDesc: Get help, submit feature requests, report bugs, or just chat with fellow terminal enthusiasts.<1>Join the Wave Discord Channel</1>
onboarding.telemetryDesc: Anonymous usage data helps us improve features you use.<1>Privacy Policy</1>
onboarding.telemetryDisabledDesc1: No problem, we respect your privacy.
onboarding.telemetryDisabledDesc2: But, without usage data, we're flying blind. A GitHub star helps us know Wave is useful and worth maintaining.
onboarding.waveAiDesc: Wave AI is your terminal assistant with context. I can read your terminal output, analyze widgets, read/write files, and help you solve problems faster.
onboarding.waveAiToggleWithHeaderButton: Toggle the Wave AI panel with the <0/> button in the header (top left)
onboarding.waveAiToggleWithShortcut: Or use the keyboard shortcut <0>{{shortcutKey}}</0> to quickly toggle
onboarding.waveAiByokDesc: Bring your own API keys or run local models with Ollama, LM Studio, and other OpenAI-compatible providers
onboarding.magnifyDesc1: Magnify any block to focus on what matters. Expand terminals, editors, and previews for a better view.
onboarding.magnifyDesc2: Use the magnify feature to work with complex outputs and large files more efficiently.
onboarding.magnifyClickIcon: You can also magnify a block by clicking on the <0/> icon in the block header.
onboarding.magnifyQuickToggle: A quick {{shortcutKey}}-M to magnify and another {{shortcutKey}}-M to unmagnify
onboarding.filesDesc: Wave can preview markdown, images, and video files on both local and remote machines.
onboarding.filesUseWshView: Use <0/> to preview files in Wave's graphical viewer
onboarding.filesUseWshEdit: Use <0/> to open config files or code files in Wave's graphical editor
onboarding.filesCommandsWorkLocallyAndRemotely: These commands work seamlessly on both local and remote machines, making it easy to view and edit files wherever they are.

upgradeMinor.waveAiIntro: Wave AI is your terminal assistant with full context. It can read your terminal output, analyze widgets, read and write files, and help you solve problems faster.
upgradeMinor.newInVersion: <0>New in v{{version}}:</0> Wave AI now supports local models and bring-your-own-key! Use Ollama, LM Studio, vLLM, OpenRouter, or any OpenAI-compatible provider.
upgradeMinor.betaFeedback: Wave AI is in beta with included AI credits while we refine the experience. We're actively improving it and would love your feedback in <0>Discord</0>.
upgradeMinor.thanks: Thanks for being an early Wave adopter! ‚≠ê
upgradeMinor.githubStarDesc: A GitHub star shows your support for Wave (and open-source) and helps us reach more developers.

v0121.summary: Patch release focused on shell integration improvements, Wave AI enhancements, and restoring syntax highlighting in code editor blocks.

shell.title: Shell Integration & Context
shell.osc7: <0>OSC 7 Support</0> - Wave now automatically tracks and restores your current directory across restarts for bash, zsh, fish, and pwsh shells
shell.contextTracking: <0>Shell Context Tracking</0> - Tracks when your shell is ready, last command executed, and exit codes for better terminal management

waveAi.title: Wave AI Improvements
waveAi.bullet1: Display reasoning summaries while waiting for AI responses
waveAi.bullet2: Enhanced terminal context - AI now has access to shell state, current directory, command history, and exit codes
waveAi.bullet3: Added feedback buttons (thumbs up/down) for AI responses
waveAi.bullet4: Added copy button to easily copy AI responses to clipboard

other.title: Other Changes
other.bullet1: Mobile user agent emulation support for web widgets
other.bullet2: Fixed padding for header buttons in code editor
other.bullet3: Restored syntax highlighting in code editor preview blocks

v0122.summary: Wave AI can now create and modify files with visual diff previews and easy rollback capabilities. Plus performance improvements and bug fixes.

fileEditing.title: Wave AI File Editing
fileEditing.bullet1: <0>File Write Tool</0> - Wave AI can now create and modify files with your approval
fileEditing.bullet2: <0>Visual Diff Preview</0> - See exactly what will change before approving edits
fileEditing.bullet3: <0>Easy Rollback</0> - Revert file changes with a simple "Revert File" button

aiImprovements.title: Additional AI Improvements
aiImprovements.bullet1: Drag & drop files from preview viewer directly to Wave AI
aiImprovements.bullet2: Directory listings support in <0>`wsh ai`</0> commands
aiImprovements.bullet3: Adjustable thinking level and max output tokens per chat
aiImprovements.bullet4: Improved tool descriptions and input validations

bugFixes.title: Bug Fixes & Improvements
bugFixes.bullet1: Fixed significant memory leak in the RPC system

v0123.summary: Wave AI model upgrade to GPT-5.1, new secret management features, and improved terminal input handling for interactive CLI tools.

waveAi.title: Wave AI Updates
waveAi.bullet1: <0>GPT-5.1 Model</0> - Upgraded to OpenAI's GPT-5.1 model for improved responses
waveAi.bullet2: <0>Thinking Mode Toggle</0> - New dropdown to select between Quick, Balanced, and Deep thinking modes
waveAi.bullet3: Fixed path mismatch issue when restoring AI write file backups

terminal.title: Terminal Improvements
terminal.bullet1: <0>Enhanced Input Handling</0> - Better support for CLI tools like Claude Code
terminal.bullet2: <0>Image Paste Support</0> - Paste images directly into terminal (saved to temp files)
terminal.bullet3: Shift+Enter now inserts newlines by default for multi-line commands
terminal.bullet4: Fixed duplicate text issue when switching input methods (IME)

secretStore.title: Secret Store
secretStore.bullet1: <0>Secret Management Widget</0> - Store and manage sensitive credentials securely
secretStore.bullet2: Access secrets via CLI with <0>wsh secret list/get/set</0> commands

v0130.summary: Wave v0.13 brings local AI support, bring-your-own-key (BYOK), a redesigned configuration system, and improved terminal functionality.

localAi.title: Local AI & BYOK
localAi.bullet1: <0>OpenAI-Compatible API</0> - Connect to Ollama, LM Studio, vLLM, OpenRouter, and other local or hosted models
localAi.bullet2: <0>Google Gemini</0> - Native support for Gemini models
localAi.bullet3: <0>Provider Presets</0> - Built-in configs for OpenAI, OpenRouter, Google, Azure, and custom endpoints
localAi.bullet4: <0>Multiple AI Modes</0> - Easily switch between models and providers

configWidget.title: Configuration Widget
configWidget.bullet1: <0>New Config Interface</0> - Dedicated widget accessible from the sidebar
configWidget.bullet2: <0>Better Organization</0> - Browse and edit settings with improved validation and error handling
configWidget.bullet3: <0>Integrated Secrets</0> - Manage API keys and credentials from the config widget

terminal.title: Terminal Updates
terminal.bullet1: <0>Bracketed Paste Mode</0> - Enabled by default for better multi-line paste behavior
terminal.bullet2: <0>Windows Paste Fix</0> - Ctrl+V now works as standard paste on Windows
terminal.bullet3: <0>SSH Password Storage</0> - Store SSH passwords in Wave's secret store

v0131.summary: Wave v0.13.1 focuses on Windows platform improvements, Wave AI visual updates, and enhanced terminal navigation.

windows.title: Windows Platform Enhancements
windows.bullet1: <0>Integrated Window Layout</0> - Cleaner interface with controls integrated into the tab-bar header
windows.bullet2: <0>Git Bash Auto-Detection</0> - Automatically detects Git Bash installations
windows.bullet3: <0>SSH Agent Fallback</0> - Improved SSH agent support on Windows
windows.bullet4: <0>Updated Focus Keybinding</0> - Wave AI focus key changed to Alt:0 on Windows

waveAi.title: Wave AI Updates
waveAi.bullet1: <0>Refreshed Visual Design</0> - Complete UI refresh with transparency support for custom backgrounds
waveAi.bullet2: <0>BYOK Without Telemetry</0> - Wave AI now works with bring-your-own-key and local models without requiring telemetry

terminal.title: Terminal Improvements
terminal.bullet1: <0>New Scrolling Keybindings</0> - Added Shift+Home, Shift+End, Shift+PageUp, and Shift+PageDown for better navigation

tab.configCleanDesc: There are no longer any errors detected in your config.

workspace.confirmCloseWindowUnsavedTabs: Window has unsaved tabs, closing window will delete existing tabs.\n\nContinue?
workspace.confirmDeleteWorkspace: Deleting workspace will also delete its contents.\n\nContinue?

about.title: Wave Terminal
about.description: Open-Source AI-Native Terminal<0/>Built for Seamless Workflows

launcher.noWidgets: No widgets found. Press Escape to clear search.

secrets.emptyDesc: Add a secret to get started
secrets.nameHelp: Must start with a letter and contain only letters, numbers, and underscores
secrets.hiddenNotice: The current secret value is not shown by default for security purposes.

connection.wshNotInstalled: wsh is not installed for this connection

aipanel.dropFilesDesc: Images, PDFs, and text/code files supported
aipanel.fileRejectedUnsupportedType_one: {{count}} file rejected (unsupported type): {{fileNames}}. Supported: images, PDFs, and text/code files.
aipanel.fileRejectedUnsupportedType_other: {{count}} files rejected (unsupported type): {{fileNames}}. Supported: images, PDFs, and text/code files.
aipanel.welcomeDesc: Wave AI is your terminal assistant with context. I can read your terminal output, analyze widgets, access files, and help you solve problems faster.
aipanel.widgetContextDescOn: When ON, I can read your terminal and analyze widgets.
aipanel.widgetContextDescOff: When OFF, I'm sandboxed with no system access.
aipanel.dragDropDesc: Drag & drop files or images for analysis
aipanel.streamIssueMissingAssistant: This response ended without an assistant message. It may have been truncated.
aipanel.streamIssueNoRenderableContent: This response ended but no visible content was rendered.
aipanel.betaMsg: BETA: Free to use. Daily limits keep our costs in check.
aipanel.builderWelcomeDesc: The WaveApp builder helps create wave widgets that integrate seamlessly into Wave Terminal.
aipanel.enableTelemetryToUnlockWaveAiCloud: (enable telemetry to unlock Wave AI Cloud)
aipanel.noToolsWarning: Warning: This custom mode was configured without the "tools" capability in the "ai:capabilities" array. Without tool support, Wave AI will not be able to interact with widgets or files.

byokAnnouncement.title: New: BYOK & Local AI Support
byokAnnouncement.desc: Wave AI now supports bring-your-own-key (BYOK) with OpenAI, Google Gemini, Azure, and OpenRouter, plus local models via Ollama, LM Studio, and other OpenAI-compatible providers.

aipanel.telemetryRequiredDesc: Wave AI is free to use and provides integrated AI chat that can interact with your widgets, help you with code, analyze files, and assist with your terminal workflows.
aipanel.telemetryDesc1: To keep Wave AI free for everyone, we require a small amount of anonymous usage data (app version, feature usage, system info).
aipanel.telemetryDesc2: This helps us block abuse by automated systems and ensure it's used by real people like you.
aipanel.telemetryDesc3: We never collect your files, prompts, keystrokes, hostnames, or personally identifying information. Wave AI is powered by OpenAI's APIs, please refer to OpenAI's privacy policy for details on how they handle your data.
aipanel.telemetryDesc4: For information about BYOK and local model support, see

feedback.localSpeechUnavailable: Local speech synthesis is not available in this environment.
feedback.apiSpeechUnavailable: Current mode has no OpenAI-compatible speech endpoint. Configure ai:endpoint and ai:apitoken.
